word-definition: A room or area in a house or building where food is prepared and cooked.

word-grammar-notes: The word 'кухня' is a feminine noun and follows the first declension pattern in Ukrainian.

word-examples.word-example-target-field_explanation: The example of the word-target in the target language as an array, each word or character is a separate element in the array

word-examples.word-example-translation-field_explanati: The translation of the word-example-target-array. Each element in the array should correspond to the element with the same index in the word-example-target-array. Each array should therefore have the same length.

word-inflections.word-inflection-origin-script_field_expl: The word-inflection-target in the script of the origin language
word-inflections.word-inflection-explanation: The genitive case (родовий відмінок) in Ukrainian is used to indicate possession, absence, quantity, and other relationships. It answers the questions `чого?` (choho? – `of what?`) or `кого?` (koho? – `of whom?`).

word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-translation-fiel: The translation of the word-inflection-example-target-array. Each element in the array should correspond to the element with the same index in the word-inflection-example-target-array. Each array should therefore have the same length.
word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-translation_fiel: The translation of the word-inflection-example-target-array in the origin language as a single string
word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-explanation: The kitchen is in possession of the door

word-inflections.word-inflection-origin-script_field_expl: The word-inflection-target in the script of the origin language
word-inflections.word-inflection-explanation: The dative case (давальний відмінок) in Ukrainian is used to indicate the indirect object of a verb. It answers the questions `кому?` (komu? – `to whom?`) or `чому?` (chomu? – `to what?`).

word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-target-field_exp: The example of the word-inflection-target in the target language as an array, each word or character is a separate element in the array

word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-translation-fiel: The translation of the word-inflection-example-target-array. Each element in the array should correspond to the element with the same index in the word-inflection-example-target-array. Each array should therefore have the same length.
word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-translation: I give flowers to the kitchen.
word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-translation_fiel: The translation of the word-inflection-example-target-array in the origin language as a single string
word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-explanation: The kitchen is the indirect object of the verb 'give'

word-inflections.word-inflection-origin-script_field_expl: The word-inflection-target in the script of the origin language
word-inflections.word-inflection-explanation: The accusative case (знахідний відмінок) in Ukrainian is used to indicate the direct object of a verb. It answers the questions `кого?` (koho? – `whom?`) or `що?` (shcho? – `what?`).

word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-translation-fiel: The translation of the word-inflection-example-target-array. Each element in the array should correspond to the element with the same index in the word-inflection-example-target-array. Each array should therefore have the same length.
word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-translation_fiel: The translation of the word-inflection-example-target-array in the origin language as a single string
word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-explanation: The kitchen is the direct object of the verb 'clean'

word-inflections.word-inflection-origin-script_field_expl: The word-inflection-target in the script of the origin language
word-inflections.word-inflection-explanation: The instrumental case (орудний відмінок) in Ukrainian is used to indicate the means or instrument by which an action is performed. It answers the questions `ким?` (kym? – `by whom?`) or `чим?` (chym? – `by what?`).

word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-origin-script-fi: The word-inflection-example-target-array in the script of the origin language
word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-translation-fiel: The translation of the word-inflection-example-target-array. Each element in the array should correspond to the element with the same index in the word-inflection-example-target-array. Each array should therefore have the same length.
word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-translation: I cook dinner in the kitchen.
word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-translation_fiel: The translation of the word-inflection-example-target-array in the origin language as a single string
word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-explanation: The kitchen is the means by which the action of cooking is performed

word-inflections.word-inflection-origin-script_field_expl: The word-inflection-target in the script of the origin language
word-inflections.word-inflection-explanation: The locative case (місцевий відмінок) in Ukrainian is used to indicate location. It answers the questions `де?` (de? – `where?`) or `на чому?` (na chomu? – `on what?`).

word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-translation-fiel: The translation of the word-inflection-example-target-array. Each element in the array should correspond to the element with the same index in the word-inflection-example-target-array. Each array should therefore have the same length.

word-inflection-examples.word-inflection-example-explanation: The kitchen is the location where the action of eating takes place

word-inflections.word-inflection-origin-script_field_expl: The word-inflection-target in the script of the origin language
word-inflections.word-inflection-explanation: The vocative case (кличний відмінок) in Ukrainian is used to address or call someone or something directly. It is rarely used for inanimate objects like 'kitchen.'
